paragraphs.content: To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David.
paragraphs.contentHtml: To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David.

paragraphs.content: The fool hath said in his heart, There is no God. They are corrupt, they have done abominable works, there is none that doeth good.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The fool hath said in his heart, There is no God. They are corrupt, they have done abominable works, there is none that doeth good.

paragraphs.content: The LORD looked down from heaven upon the children of men, to see if there were any that did understand, and seek God.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The Lord looked down from heaven upon the children of men, to see if there were any that did understand, and seek God.

paragraphs.content: They are all gone aside, they are all together become filthy: there is none that doeth good, no, not one.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They are all gone aside, they are all together become filthy: there is none that doeth good, no, not one.

paragraphs.content: Have all the workers of iniquity no knowledge? who eat up my people as they eat bread, and call not upon the LORD.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Have all the workers of iniquity no knowledge? who eat up my people as they eat bread, and call not upon the Lord.

paragraphs.content: There were they in great fear: for God is in the generation of the righteous.
paragraphs.contentHtml: There were they in great fear: for God is in the generation of the righteous.

paragraphs.content: Ye have shamed the counsel of the poor, because the LORD is his refuge.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Ye have shamed the counsel of the poor, because the Lord is his refuge.

paragraphs.content: Oh that the salvation of Israel were come out of Zion! when the LORD bringeth back the captivity of his people, Jacob shall rejoice, and Israel shall be glad.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Oh that the salvation of Israel were come out of Zion! when the Lord bringeth back the captivity of his people, Jacob shall rejoice, and Israel shall be glad.
